INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Significant decrease of the plasma concentrations of the abiraterone, with risk of lower effectiveness
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of afatinib due to increase of its metabolism by these substances
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring during the administration of these substances together and 1 to 2 weeks after they are stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Large decrease of the plasma concentrations of the albendazole and of its active metabolite by the inducer, with risk of reduction of its effectiveness.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring of the therapeutic response and possible adjustment of the dosage of the albendazole during the treatment with the enzyme inducer and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the calcium channel blocker due to increase of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: with the nimodipine

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the antiarrhythmic, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, EKG, and testing of the plasma concentrations; if needed, adjustment of the dosage of the antiarrhythmic during the treatment with the inducer and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease (or, infrequently, increase with the phenytoin) of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the anticonvulsant inducer
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the anticonvulsant inducer and a week after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decreased of the plasma concentrations of the apixaban by the anticonvulsant enzyme inducer, with risk of lower therapeutic effect.
Risk of very large decrease of the concentrations of aprepitant
Risk of decrease of the plasma concentrations of boceprevir
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If administering these substances together cannot be avoided, regular clinical and biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of the administration of the substances together

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the plasma concentrations of bosentan
Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the cobicistat due to increase of its metabolism by the inducer
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of dabigatran, with risk of decrease of the therapeutic effect
Risk of decrease of the plasma concentrations of deferasirox
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Monitor the ferritinemia during and after the treatment with the enzyme inducer. If needed, adjustment of the dosage of deferasirox.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentratioins of delamanid due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer.
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the doxycycline due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the doxycycline

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Large decrease of the concentrations of dronedarone due to increase of its metabolism, without notable modification of the active metabolite

Decrease of the effectiveness of the estrogen
.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the hormonal treatment during the administration of the anticonvulsant inducer and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of fentanyl due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the anticonvulsant
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Choose another opioid.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the corticoids due to increase of their hepatic metabolism by the inducer: the consequences are particularly great with patients who have Addisons disease treated with hydrocortisone and in cases of organ transplants
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical and biological monitoring; adjustment of the dosage of the corticoids during the treatment with the inducer and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Clinical monitoring and, if needed, dosage adjustment during the treatment with carbamazepine and after it is stopped.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and, if needed, dosage adjustment during the treatment with the carbamazepine and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of clinically low thyroid in patients with hypothyroidism, due to increase of the metabolism of the T3 and of the T4
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Monitoring of the serum concentrations of T3 and T4 and adjustment, if needed, of the dosage of the thyroid hormones during the treatment with the inducer and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of idelalisib due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the anticonvulsant enzyme inducer
Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the protease inhibitor due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical and biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of the administration of these substances together

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the tyrosine kinase inhibitor, due to increase of its metabolism by the inducer
Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the ivabradine, due to increase of its metabolism by the inducer
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the ivabradine during the administration of these substances together and after the inducer is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Large decrease of the plasma concentrations of the ledipasvir due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the anticonvulsant enzyme inducer.
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the metronidazole due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of metronidazole during the treatment with the inducer and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the plasma concentration of the midazolam by the anticonvulsant

Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the corticoids due to increase of their hepatic metabolism by the inducer: the consequences are particularly great in patients with Addisons disease treated with the hydrocortisone and in the case of transplants.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical and biological monitoring; adjustment of the dosage of the corticoids during the treatment with the inducer and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the montelukast due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the antiasthmatic during the treatment with the inducer and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the calcium channel blocker due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the calcium channel blocker during the treatment with the inducer and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Large decrease (up to two thirds) of the concentrations of perampanel
Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the posaconazole
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring. If possible, plasma dosages of the posaconazole and possible adjustment of its dosage.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Very large decrease of the plasma concentrations of the praziquantel, with risk of failure of the treatment due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
Increase of the hypersensitivity reactions (hypereosinophilia, rash), due to increase of the metabolism of the procarbazine by the inducer
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the propafenone due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and EKG. If there is reason for it, adjustment of the dosage of the propafenone during its administration with the inducer and after the inducer is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Very large decrease of the plasma concentrations of quetiapine due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer, with risk of ineffectiveness.
Risk of loss of the effectiveness of the quinine due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the quinine during the treatment with the inducer and after it is stopped

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of large decrease of the concentrations of ranolazine
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of rivaroxaban, with risk of decrease of the therapeutic effect.
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the anticonvulsant, with risk of overdose, due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism by the stiripentol.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and plasma dosage, when that is possible, of the anticonvulsant taken with the stiripentol and possible adjustment of its dosage.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of very large decrease of the concentrations of telaprevir
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the telithromycin, with risk of failure of the antibiotic treatment due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the theophylline due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and, if needed, monitoring of the theophyllinemia. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the theophylline during the treatment with the inducer and after it is stopped

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the tiagabine due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
INTERACTION.COMMENT: An increase of the dosage of tiagabine can prove necessary when it is administered with an anticonvulsant enzyme inducer

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Large decrease of the plasma concentrations of ticagrelor due to increase of its hepatic metabolsim by the anticonvulsant enzyme inducer, with risk of decrease of the therapeutic effect.
Risk of decrease of the effect of the ulipristal, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Choose a therapeutic alternative that is little or not at all metabolized.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the concentrations of vitamin D more marked than in the absence of the inducer.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Concentration dosage of vitamin D and supplementation if necessary

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION:
-for carbamazipine, phenobarbital, primidone: Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the voriconazole due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
For phenytoin, fosphenytoin:
Large decrease of the plasma concentrations of the voriconazole with risk of loss of effectiveness, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the phenytoin, for one thing; and increase of the plasma concentrations of the phenytoin due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the voriconazole for another thing
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -for carbamazepine, phenobarbital, primidone
